Posts.Content: Trying to find someone who has had fibromatosis of the breast-- an extremely rare, aggressive non-cancerous tumor than can be fatal. I have found literature on the topic but would love to find either a patient who has had it or a doctor who has treated it. Thank you.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with fibromatosis

Posts.Content: Cay, I am so sorry about your delay in diagnosis. How terribly frustrating. I am in the U.S. As it turns out, my diagnosis was incorrect. The way I found that out was that I had been referred to a general surgeon at the hospital where I was diagnosed. It is a top-100 hospital and he is the chief surgeon at the hospital But while he does a lot of breast surgery, he wasn't solely a breast surgeon. Given that this was such an unusual condition I wanted someone whose entire focus was breasts. I took my pathology slides, films and written diagnosis to a teaching hospital that had several superb breast surgeons. The radiologist, pathologist and surgeon at hospital #2 overruled the initial diagnosis. They suspect I probably had milk of calcium (harmless). But they could not know for sure since it had been aspirated and absorbed during the core biopsy. As the biopsy was originally done due to a followup mammogram and sonogram showing microcalcifications that were BIRADS 4 (too suspicious looking to take a "wait and see" approach) the milk of calcium theory makes more sense. So, I'm afraid I'm not able to be any help, Cay. I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers. Now that you're diagnosed you're on the way to recovery. Hang in there. Jenifer
Posts.Title: Diagnosed with fibromatosis

Posts.Content: I experienced extreme pain during stereotactic biospy. I know this is quite rare. My radiologists was responsive and gave extra lydocaine but it still hurt terribly. I was not nervous or apprehensive prior to procedure. Question: If I have to have this done again is the procedure ever done with a epidural for the area or twilight sleep?
Posts.Title: Excruciating pain during stereotactic biopsy

Posts.Title: Excruciating pain during stereotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your helpful and informative responsives. Due to your thoughtful feedback I know I have several options for pain avoidance, pain reduction if I have to have the procedure again. I was very blessed. My sample turned out to be benign. With much appreciation.

Posts.Title: Excruciating pain during stereotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry your news is not as happy as mine. The pain I had was an exception to the rule. They didn't get to insert the pin because I moved. Honestly I think it's unusual. And, I have extremely dense breasts due to never having kids and being pre-menopausal. I believe that's why I the had such significant pain -- a learning from one of the replies I received. Re: finding a surgeon on your plan. How frustrating. Does your state have a coalition on cancer? Mine does (Georgia) and I found the names of excellent breast surgeons there. Just a thought. Hang in there!
